dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 3071 IH: No Special Treatment for Congress Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gingrey of Georgia introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to provide that no Government contribution may be made toward the cost of Exchange coverage for any Member of Congress or congressional staff.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Special Treatment for Congress Act.
Section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 18032(d)(3)(D)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating clause (ii) as clause (iii); and
by inserting after clause (i) the following:

clause.text: Notwithstanding any provision of chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, or of any other law, no Government contribution under such chapter may be made for health benefits obtained by any Member of Congress or congressional staff in accordance with clause (i).
